knowledge: DMARDs DMARDs  DMARDs are a category of drugs used to treat autoimmune diseases like rheumatoid arthritis.  csDMARDs or conventional synthetic DMARDs are the first-line treatment for RA.  They work by suppressing the immune system and slowing the progression of the disease.  TNF biologics are another category of DMARDs that block the action of tumor necrosis factor, a protein involved in inflammation.  They are often used in combination with csDMARDs for better efficacy.  tsDMARDs are a newer category of DMARDs that target specific cells in the immune system.  They are often used when other treatments have failed or are not well tolerated. DMARDs can have potential side effects such as liver toxicity, increased risk of infection, and gastrointestinal problems DMARDs DMARDs
